title: Environmental Education Design Utilizing Digital Storytelling and Jigsaw Cooperative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic environmental concepts and fundamental digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: Most learners use smartphones as their primary learning tool, with the non-degree course aiming to enhance environmental awareness and mathematical analytical skills

learning_goals: Learners can create digital storytelling content that connects the mythological significance of water with contemporary environmental issues.
Learners can explore and present four topics—water cycle, historical usage patterns, pollution impacts—in groups through the jigsaw cooperative learning method.
Learners can analyze environmental data using mathematical tools (graphs, statistics) to propose problem-solving strategies.

resources: Open-Source Software for Environmental Data Analysis
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
